From: Luis
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 26, 2004 5:22 PM
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire


Hi everyone.

I managed to download 96% of the mpeg video but aparently it went
offline again. Anyone got any better luck?


Luis

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: ... Jon, thanks for the offer. let s  see what we can do with Limewire. If there is no way, I will send it to you, but at that point it would be worth to send
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 25, 2004, at 10:06 AM, Cesare Polenghi wrote:

>> Hi all,
>>
>> I've been unable to locate it on limewire using various searches.
>>
>> I am in the UK.
>>
>> I run a webhosting company, so if you can send it to me on CD I'll
>> upload it to one of our webservers for all to access.
>>
>> Let me know.
>>
>> Regards,
>>
>> Jon

Jon, thanks for the offer. let's see what we can do with Limewire. If
there is no way, I will send it to you, but at that point it would be
worth to send you other digital video materiaI have - the problem is
always: how do we cope with eventual copyright infringement?
cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sorry, my network was down for a few hours :o( Now it s all running again, and it will be for another 10 hours. I might actually leave it on 24 hours for a
messages.messageBody:
On Jan 25, 2004, at 10:06 AM, Cesare Polenghi wrote:

> It's 10 AM in Hawaii: I just opened Limewire, and I will leave it up
> and running for the next 18 hours or so. Let' s see what happens.
> cepo

Sorry, my network was down for a few hours :o(
Now it's all running again, and it will be for another 10 hours. I
might actually leave it on 24 hours for a couple of days. (wife
willing....)
cepo

messages.subject: R: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire

download? Address?

A: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Oggetto: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire

It's 10 AM in Hawaii: I just opened Limewire, and I will leave it up
and running for the next 18 hours or so. Let' s see what happens.
cepo

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I ve been unable to locate it on limewire using various searches. I am in the UK. I run a webhosting company, so if you can send it to me on CD I ll
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,

I've been unable to locate it on limewire using various searches.

I am in the UK.

I run a webhosting company, so if you can send it to me on CD I'll upload it to one of our webservers for all to access.

Let me know.

Regards,

Jon


----- Original Message -----
From: Luis
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, January 25, 2004 3:11 PM
Subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Mass lecture on Limewire


Hi.

I was downloading it but Limewire told me to search for more sources
(5:09:43 AM, Honolulu local time). It was at 4% so if anyone else closer
from Portugal has this and can share it or put it on an FTP or Web
server I would appreciate it :)

Tnx,
Luis

messages.subject: Re: Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: I think I was one of the 12, although I ve only been able to get about 6% of it so far (and now the file is gone again) - That would be great if a few more
messages.messageBody:
I think I was one of the 12, although I've only been able to get
about 6% of it so far (and now the file is gone again) - That would
be great if a few more people would put it up, and if I can
eventually get the whole thing, I'll leave it up. My computer is on
at least 12 hours a day.


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Cesare Polenghi <cepo@d...>
wrote:
> Seems like 12 people downloaded it tonight only :o)
> If some of you here in the list were among them, please let me
know,
> and please leave it in your Limewire shared folder, so that more
people
> can download and enjoy. I hope is not copyrighted, however culture
> should be shared... errr... do you agree?
> cepo

messages.subject: Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: Seems like 12 people downloaded it tonight only :o) If some of you here in the list were among them, please let me know, and please leave it in your Limewire
messages.messageBody:
Seems like 12 people downloaded it tonight only :o)
If some of you here in the list were among them, please let me know,
and please leave it in your Limewire shared folder, so that more people
can download and enjoy. I hope is not copyrighted, however culture
should be shared... errr... do you agree?
cepo

messages.messageBody:

I've been trying to search for it on Limewire but it never shows up on
the search results... Last searches were at around 23.00 GMT yesterday
and 11.00 GMT today.

Are you still sharing it?


Thanks,
Luis

messages.subject: Mass lecture on Limewire
messages.msgSnippet: I am sharing Mass lecture The 1000 years of the samurai, a must. Its a ca.600MB, 55mins mpeg. If you have Limewire (free at www.limewire.com) just make a
messages.messageBody:
I am sharing Mass' lecture "The 1000 years of the samurai," a must. Its
a ca.600MB, 55mins mpeg.
If you have Limewire (free at www.limewire.com) just make a search for
"mass," "1000," "samurai," or one of the two. My computer is often on,
so you can download. I turn it off only late at night, but you can try
again, and continue the download the day after, without need to search
from the beginning. Or either Email me to let me know you're
downloading, so I will leave it on all night.
cepo
